title: Bering Land Bridge National Preserve: Things to Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do        People hiking on tundra. NPS Photo   Â    Camping  Check out our tips on sit selection and Leave No Trace ethics. There are no designated camping sites.    Hiking and Backpacking  The preserve can be a backpacker's dream as it offers a vast expanse of terrain to explore.   Bird Watching  The Seward Peninsula is a natural corridor for over a hundred species that make an annual migration through the area.    Hunting  Hunting and trapping is permitted in the preserve.    Fishing A bounty of fish found in Bering Land Bridge provides for a unique fishing experience in the backcountry.    Berry Picking  With nearly 50 species of wild berries in Alaska, autumn is a time of great abundance in the Seward Peninsula.    Flying  Experience a large expanse of the preserve from a bird's point of view.   Snowmobiling Access the preserve during the winter as it is blanketed in snow.   Wildlife Viewing Wildlife encounters can be one of the most unique and genuine moments the preserve offers. Ensure your wildlife sightings are safe and smart.  Ranger Programs Bering Land Bridge offers a variety of programs during the summer months at the Visitor Center located in Nome, AK.
